reviewText: This series is good if you are just looking for a gore fix. Sometimes you want something that doesn't try to work in a confusing or non-related plot, and this is it. Simple, straight-forward revenge story that focuses on maiming and swordplay. Pretty short at around 6 episodes, but this set also comes with the Afro Samurai Resurrection Movie, and for the price, I say pick it up.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Review the box set it's self I would have to say. This is one of the most unique box sets I have ever seen. The box set its self actually opens like a book to reveal two thin dvd cases inside. If thats not good enough for you a portrait of the afro samurai and his nemesis is inside. SWEET. Could it get any better? Well it does the art on both thin dvd cases are great and on the reverse side is what seems to be a rap and it is pretty good. The dvds are a simple black but very attractive dvd. The back of the box is just as great. This is one of the best box sets I have seen in awhile. If you like afro samurai this is a must buy it is a great buy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Plain and simple, if you like action scoop this up! You don't even have to be an anime fan to love this series! Samuel L. Jackson rules as both Afro and his imaginary friend Ninja-Ninja, plus Ron Pearlman and Lucy Lu voice acting and the RZA on the beats, you just can't go wrong! Here is hoping they keep it going a little while longer!

reviewText: It was excellent superb dynamite adventurous. Keep an open mind and you'll see what I mean. I LOVE IT. THANK YOU FUNIMATION AND AMAZON.

reviewText: Great Anime! I watched the first part or the second season on spike and i was hooked ever since. Samurai X meet boondocks with a dash of samurai champloon. I dont really care for they ended to soon like cowboy bebop where their was plenty of room to grow the charater or extend the story or do another season about what happened during the time between season one and two. But im sure if you know anything about this series you are already a fan.

reviewText: Afro Samurai is my favorite anime hero I have seen the first movie but when I saw the second movie was in the package I had to have it
summary: Two good movies for the price of one
